Title:
A new species of Conidiobolus with chlamydospore from Dabie
Mountain, Eastern China
Abstract:
Conidiobolus is a widely distributed genus throughout the
world, and the types of its resting spores include zygospore,
chlamydospore and villose conidia. Conidiobolus dabieensis is confirmed
as a new species with chlamydospore within the genus Conidiobolus based
on the morphological evidence and the molecular data of LSU rDNA region.
The new species differs from morphologically similar Conidiobolus
species: C. adiaeretus by its absence of capilliconidia, and from C.
firmipilleus by its slightly larger primary conidia and slender and
curvious germ hypha arised from a single conidium. Phylogenetic analysis
indicates the new species closely related to C. humicolus, C.
khandalensis and C. firmipilleus, but distinct from the former two
species by its length of primary conidia.
